interestingFacts: Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands and is famous for its advanced technology and traditional tea ceremonies.
Germany is known for its beer culture and hosts the world's largest beer festival, Oktoberfest.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world’s oxygen.
India has the world's second-largest population and is known for its rich cultural diversity.
France is the most visited country in the world, famous for its art, cuisine, and the Eiffel Tower.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Bloemfontein, and Cape Town, each serving a different governmental purpose.
The U.S. is the third most populous country and is known for its diverse landscapes and innovation in various industries.
New Zealand was the first country to grant women the right to vote in 1893.
